round_best: Develop a theoretical framework to analyze and quantify the separation power of hybrid equivariant neural networks that combine multiple types of symmetry (e.g., rotational, translational, and permutation invariance) by integrating differential geometry and group theory. This framework would allow the explicit calculation of the capacity of these networks to distinguish between increasingly fine distinctions in the input space based on the complexity and interaction of symmetries. Utilize the framework to design tailor-made equivariant architectures for specific application domains such as 3D medical imaging or multi-agent systems, optimizing for both accuracy and computational efficiency.
